Text.Value: No. You don't understand. You kill them.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're describing your vision. Pleading as you struggle to explain the player's future to them. Horror mounting.

Text.Value: I can't do this. You're too dangerous. I'm - I'm sorry.
I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Text.Value: You - you're the one. The mind flayer.

EditorData.NodeContext: Horror mounting.

Text.Value: Good gods...

EditorData.NodeContext: Absolute horror as you recognise the player as the monster you saw before. Lean back eyes wide and terrified.

Text.Value: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.

EditorData.NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Text.Value: Hag magic it might be, but it's never been wrong. Not once.
You're wrong. I'll stop it.
I'm so sorry.
Vile, disgusting...

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: I still hear it. Still see your eyes go dead, and you... you butcher them. Everyone around you.

EditorData.NodeContext: This is a big moment - you've just confirmed the player's worst fears. You sound utterly horrified, almost dazed, as you finish describing the scene.

Text.Value: You change, skin ripping from your body and then you butcher... everyone. Everyone around you.

EditorData.NodeContext: This is a big moment - you've just confirmed the player's worst fears. You sound utterly horrified, almost dazed, as you finish describing the scene.

Text.Value: May she burn in the Nine Hells.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hatred and fear in your voice as you think of the hag.

Text.Value: I can't stay. You're too dangerous. But I hope... I only hope it's a quick death.
I saved your life. Be grateful.
The hag - there's never been a more vile creature.

EditorData.NodeContext: Almost not speaking to the player. You mind is flashing back to the den of horrors that was the hag's lair, and the torments you suffered at her hands.

Text.Value: You can't.
I saw you screaming - covered in your own insides as that - that thing bursts out of your skull.

EditorData.NodeContext: You sound traumatised here as you mind flashes back to the player, skin peeling, vomiting their insides as they transform into a murderous killing machine.

Text.Value: Be specific. When will this happen?
Why were you even here?
I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Text.Value: I'm so sorry.
She's dead. You're safe now.
The hag - there's never been a more vile creature. The things she did to me...
I - I don't know. It could be a tenday.
No. I saw it. You're covered in blood and gore - vomiting. And then... your skull splits open.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're describing your vision. You flee at the end of this scene. Horror mounting as you recall the player - butchering everyone in their path.

Text.Value: No - the hag's 'gift' is gone but it's - it's going to happen. Soon.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're describing your vision. You flee at the end of this scene. Horror mounting as you recall the player - butchering everyone in their path

Text.Value: She's gone. You're safe now.
The things she did to me - the things she made me do I...

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: Are you all right?
No. Not even a little bit.

EditorData.NodeContext: The player has asked if you're all right. You look away, ashamed and broken.

Text.Value: Shut your damn mouth. And never call me that again.
You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?
Death can't come quick enough for you - monster.
I have no idea what you're talking about.
Yes. I will. Thank you.
I butcher everyone? That sounds delightful.
Get out of here.
Could be any moment.
Not if I can help it. Can you still see it?
You're lucky to be alive. I could have killed you.
I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: Is the hag gone? Gods, tell me she's gone. Oh, please.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're lucid and coherent but terrified - looking around you for the hag.

Text.Value: Leave darthiir - before I finished what the hag started.
The things she did - the things she made me do.

EditorData.NodeContext: Almost not speaking to the player. You mind is flashing back to the den of horrors that was the hag's lair, and the torments you suffered at her hands.

Text.Value: Yes. I will. Forgive me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hurried and subservient as you duck your head, making to leave

Text.Value: She's gone. You're safe now.
That thing bursts out of you and you're - you're screaming.

EditorData.NodeContext: You sound traumatised here as you mind flashes back to the player, skin peeling, vomiting their insides as they transform into a murderous killing machine.

Text.Value: Hells.
Say that again, and I'll rip your throat out with my teeth.
Leave while you can - and be careful.
She's dead. You're safe now.
That damn shrew would have loved it. Would have loved watching you murder me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has said you're lucky to be alive. You attacked the player against your will but they knocked you out -saving your life. You're still horrified - the hag probably planned for you to die that way.

Text.Value: Why should I trust you? Or the hag's magic?

Synopsis:
This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 
1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag
2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer
3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
